As we continue to move forward with our continuity of learning plan and await a decision regarding next steps I wanted to provide an update. Upper Cape Tech began our continuity of learning through remote learning immediately after the announcement of closure until May 4th. Given the effort exerted by teachers, support staff, students, and parents we feel it is best to continue with the originally scheduled April vacation. Our hope is that teachers, students, and parents will utilize this time to refresh and prepare for whatever comes next as we continue to stay home and defeat this pandemic. This break will also give students who did not start at the onset the opportunity to catch up. In summary, we will not have remote learning occurring during the week of April 20 - 24. Remote learning will resume on April 27th. Students will be expected to check email and Google Classroom for the week's assignment on April 27th.
Stay safe. Stay home.

Share Your Thoughts with Upper Cape Tech

Get ready to Share your Thoughts with Upper Cape Tech to help the district better understand what is important to you, as the district considers construction of a new community Athletic Center.
You are invited to participate in an anonymous Exchange that flows through three steps:

• Share – answer open-ended questions about what is important related to a community Athletic Center.
• Star – review ideas from other stakeholders and rate the ideas you like best.
• Discover – learn what is important to the community as a whole.

Beginning November 27th and running through December 7th, you will be able to click on a link on the UCT website at www.uppercapetech.com or on the school’s Facebook page to participate.
Upper Cape Tech appreciates your assistance and looks forward to hearing your thoughts!

So proud of Upper Cape Tech students participating in the MA. State Science Fair. Congrats on placing and earning scholarships. Jillian Taylor, Joe Rotondo, Bailey Nance, Elias Rotondo, Charlie Kleindinst, and Deep Kumar.

Jillian Taylor (Bourne) and Joe Rotondo (Sandwich) placed third and Joe received a $25,000 scholarship to UMass Lowell.
Bailey Nance (Bourne) received an Honorable Mention and also received a scholarship for $56,000 to Merrimack College.
Eli Rotondo (Sandwich) received a $20,000 scholarship as an alternate for UMass Amherst.
Charlie Kleindinst received a $10,000 scholarship as an alternate for Wentworth Institute of Technology.

Thanks to advisers Karen Martin-Myers & Mike Robinson.
